Utilities

Utilities for suffix tree.

suffix_tree.util.DEBUG = False

Print lots of debug information.

suffix_tree.util.DEBUG_DOT = False

Write out dot files of the tree at the end of each phase.

suffix_tree.util.DEBUG_LABELS = False

Include more (potentially confusing) information in node labels.

class suffix_tree.util.UniqueEndChar(id_)

A singleton object to signal end of sequence.

__init__(id_)
__str__()

Return str(self).

suffix_tree.util.min_debug_depth = -1

How deep we were in the stack when emitting the first debug message.

Used to print the interesting part of the stack.

suffix_tree.util.debug(msg: str, *args, **kwargs) → None

Print a debug message to stderr.

suffix_tree.util.is_debug() → bool

Return True if debugging is on.

class suffix_tree.util.Path(S: collections.abc.Sequence[collections.abc.Hashable], start: int, end: int)
class suffix_tree.util.Path(S: suffix_tree.util.Path, start: int, end: Optional[int])

A path in a suffix tree.

Paths come in two flavors: closed and open-ended. A closed path has a fixed end. In an open-ended path the end is implicitly equivalent to the current phase. When the current phase of the builder increments, the end of all open-ended paths gets incremented too. This is implemented by the property end pointing to a mutable integer (an integer stored in an array, so we can replace the integer in the array).

__init__(S: collections.abc.Sequence[collections.abc.Hashable], start: int, end: int)
__init__(S: suffix_tree.util.Path, start: int, end: Optional[int])

Initialize a path from a sequence of symbols or another path.

If end is None it is copied from the other path.

property end: int

Return the end of the path.

This is a calculated property because sometimes the end is ‘infinity’, which means that the end is assumed to be the end of the current phase.

set_open_end(value: int) → None

Set the open end marker.

This puts the value in an array used by many paths. We can replace the value in the array.

property k: int

Return the start of the path in Ukkonen’s preferred notation.

property p: int

Return the end of the path in Ukkonen’s preferred notation.

property i: int

Another end of the path in Ukkonen’s preferred notation.

classmethod from_iterable(iterable: collections.abc.Iterable[collections.abc.Hashable]) → suffix_tree.util.Path

Build a path from an iterable.

__str__() → str

Return str(self).

__lt__(other) → bool

Return True if self less than other.

Convenience function that allows to sort paths if the symbols are sortable. Not used in tree construction.

__getitem__(i: int) → collections.abc.Hashable

Return the symol at position i.

Note: this should implement slices but we don’t need them. Also we don’t need negative indices.

ukko_str() → str

Debug path in Ukkonen’s notation.
